main event: On April 21, 1952, multiple witnesses observed an unidentified bright, round, and maneuverable object in the sky over Jamesville, New York.
interesting points: The object was described as red in color and circular with many maneuvers., Witnesses observed the object moving at a high rate of speed and altering its course., The sighting lasted for several minutes before the object disappeared., The objects were estimated to be at an altitude of 6,000 to 8,000 feet., Reports suggest the objects may be classified as a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomena.
witness description: Mr. and Mrs. [redacted] and two children, ages 12 and 14
